hint: for storing computer information.
A unit of computer information.
A Data structures such as linked lists.
A way of storing data on a computer so that the last piece of data to be stored is the first one to be found by the computer.
a computer program or part of a computer program that can make copies of itself and is intended to prevent the computer from working normally.
A name that you enter in order to be able to use a computer system.
To take data or instructions from memory and put them into the central processing unit (CPU) for processing.
This involves managing or displaying data across the web, programs, and computer networks.
To obtain the value at a specific location in a list.
a series of memory locations – or 'boxes' – each of which holds a single item of data, but with each box sharing the same name.
A series of instructions that is repeated until a particular thing happens.
A template definition of the methods and variables in a particular kind of object.
To remove bugs (= problems) from software.
actions that a computer performs, such as comparing and matching, that involve simple, yes or no choices, rather than more complicated mathematics.
An area or type of computer memory in which information that is often in use can be stored temporarily, so that you can get to it quickly.
A situation in which something goes wrong in a computer program, or a message that this has happened.
Is an action or occurrence recognized by software.
A language used to program (= give instructions to) computers.
A round fruit with firm, white flesh and a green, red, or yellow skin.
is a name assigned to a piece of data, which could be a file, a data packet, a block of memory, or an element in a programming language.
